The Lord has made human agents trustees of His goods. They are stewards in trust. The Lord is the owner of all they possess, and His stewards will one day have to render a strict account as to how they have administered the 


                                   -320- 

entrusted capital. No one can with safety waste his Lord's goods merely to gratify a desire for expensive dress or furniture.--Letter 93, 1899, pp. 3, 5-7. (To "My Brethren in America," June 19, 1899.)
